scenarioDescription:
The GJ 422 Exoplanetary System


Overview

GJ 422 is a star with 0.35 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 41.30 light years away from the solar system.

GJ 422 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the GJ 422 system


GJ 422 b

GJ 422 b was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2014-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.11 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 422 b is 11.076 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GJ 422 b is 3.330 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, GJ 422 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system GJ 422, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Multiple Observatories.
name: GJ 422 - System With 1 Exoplanet
